data.title: Fragment Filter and Stage Intersection Bug
Optimization suggestion with EnterFrame event (10% performance increase on iOS for me).
data.body:
Hi,

After doing profiling with Scout, I noticed that hasEventListener and getChildEventListeners are taking a huge chunk of my CPU time, especially on iOS.
I did some digging and with a slight change to getChildEventListeners line 385, to avoid parsing the whole tree for ENTER_FRAME:

`if (container)`
to
`if (container && eventType != EnterFrameEvent.ENTER_FRAME)`

I got a 10% performance increase on my iPhone 4.
Of course, the drawback is that now, only the stage broadcast ENTER_FRAME, but from my quick check of feathers and starling, it's not really an issue for them (feathers just need 2 quick changes to listen to stage instead of a display object, but the rest of the code wont care).
In any case, since starling and feathers have no problem supporting it, it could be an opt-in flag on starling so nothing get's broken and a dev could choose to use the quick path if he wants to.

What do you think?

Sebastien

data.title: TextField leading feature
data.body:
Author: Leksikov Artem

Hi Daniel! My friend add a leading feature to the TextField class like TextFormat.leading.

data.title: Fixed bug where vertexID was being used instead of zero
data.body: getBounds() function would not work when specifyingÂ numVertices that is smaller or equal to vertexID. This was because vertexID was being used incorrectly in the for loops. Zero should have been used instead.

data.title: Memory leak
make TextField.redrawContents() public
data.body:
I ran into a problem in which a TextField is supposed to animate smoothly onto the screen, but the texture generation within TextField.createRenderedContents() blocks the animation, creating a stutter.

In general, it seems like having the ability to render a TextField in advance of it appearing on the display list is a handy thing to have, and the simplest way to achieve that is to make TextField.redrawContents() public.  If there's a better way to handle that situation than loosening access, please let me know...

data.title: Performance improve by changing rawData from vector to byteArray
data.body:
Change the rawData in VertexData from Vector.<Number> to ByteArray. Due to 50% more efficient by using buffer3D.uploadFromByteArray than uploadFromVector.

Reference:
http://jacksondunstan.com/articles/1617

But the slower performance of ByteArray read/write. The overall performance increase is about 10~20%.

data.title: render : hasVisibleArea should check off screen objects?
data.body: Maybe wrong but should'nt hasVisibleArea also check if object is outside of the screen?

data.title: DisplayObjectContainer.stableSortChildren
data.body:
Hey Daniel -

This pull request adds a "stableSortChildren" method to DisplayObjectContainer, which is useful to prevent flickering when depth-sorting children who have the same depth value (the AS3 Vector.sort algorithm is, unfortunately, not stable).

I used the insertion sort algorithm for the implementation (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Insertion_sort). Insertion sort doesn't have the best _theoretical_ runtime performance, but in practice it works very well for display object depth sorting: after the first sort of a given DisplayObjectContainer, subsequent sorts will generally be close to O(n) (because most displayObjects won't be out of order after just a single frame). It also does the sort in-place, so there's no extra allocations happening.

data.title: Add support for new hiDPI retina Macs
data.body:
Daniel, as commented on and tested in this forum topic:

http://forum.starling-framework.org/topic/latest-air-36-sdk-supports-mac-retina-hidpi

AIR 3.6 SDK added support for hiDPI, and while they only documented the app descriptor code to turn this on, it seems one also needs to make the proper call to createBackBuffer for Context3D and pass in true to the new wantsBestResolution argument.

It does say this could affect shader code somehow, so not sure if this also requires more investigation on your part with an actual retina Mac (as well as some of the concerns Josh and I mentioned in the topic when you move the app window between hiDPI and non-retina screens related to possible context loss).

I don't use any custom shaders, but would like to turn on hiDPI support with my 2x assets that I already use for retina iPads and iPhones.

Hopefully you will have time to officially add this and test it soon on real hardware.

Thanks
Jeff

data.title: Optimizing VertexData
data.body: I'v recently read the article "Boosting Starling 1.3 performance by 50%" and try to do the optimization as its said, and I also make VertexData's constructor a little faster. I does some tests and it seems fine.

data.title: Display object with procedural texture.
data.body:
It would be great if you create class like Quad class, but with very simple way to perform user GPU code - e.g. by invoking a method with source code as parameter.

There is a similar thing - FragmentFilter class; but:
1. I have to subclass it to use it.
2. I have to use it with host object (two passes).

Correct me if I am wrong or I do not see something.

data.title: Simple, but quick helper.
Button touch events not working properly in IE 10 (win 8)
data.body:
Hi there,

I have tested my app on IE7/IE8 and it works just fine.
Also on MacOs (Chrome,Safari).

However only on Windows 8 and IE 10 the following problem occurs:

Clicking directly on a button causes no event to be fired. However if you click somewhat offset to the right and bottom of the button (OUTSIDE the button) the event is processed.
Chrome on Win 8 works just fine. So it seems to be a problem in IE 10 (RT and Desktop mode) only.

I am using the latest Flash version: 11,6,602,171

The problem can be easily reproduced with the Whack! online game:

http://www.whacksite.com/

1) Hit the 'New Game' button (this button works fine)
2) Play once.
3) A 'Try Again' button will appear. Try clicking on it, nothing should happen. If you click outside the button, somewhat offset to the right bottom the event handler will be executed.
If I try this in Chrome, it all works fine.

Thanks!

data.title: Add ability to play a section in a MovieClip
data.body:
Now, Movieclip only allow play and loop all frames. I have add ability to play only a section in the Movieclip. You can use play( startFrame, sectionLength) to play a section within the movieclip. 

If you have a animation with different state, you can use only one Moveclip to represent all states. So, no need to use different move clip for different state. Best if you have a character with different animation.

data.title: Colors.
data.body:
If you want to, I could complement list of colors in starling.utils.Color.
I propose colors from official color list on (maybe not all, heh, part of that list):

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_colors:_A-M
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_colors:_N-Z#Colors_in_alphabetical_order_N-Z

The second thing are space-transform methods (e.g. from RGB to HSV), GreyScale(), etc.

I am ready to help.

data.title: DisplayObject rotation in 3D.
data.body:
Idea is to make 3D-rotations of display objects around pivots possible.
I know that it is not a small deal :)

There are plenty of applications of it, e.g. carousels, cool fade-ins, fade-outs of objects.

data.title: Pixel snapping
data.body:
Could you consider adding a optimize way to round all objects coordinates to nearest pixel?
Actually with non retina/hd display we got blurry image when they re not round to pixel

data.title: Rendering overhead
data.body:
I have a scene with ~200 images and some animations (which all are stopped), nothing is changing in runtime, nor position of anything, nor visibility.
But every frame I had a ~200 calls to function VertexBuffer3D.uploadFromVector() which came from Image.render().
As I understand the vertex buffer shouldn't be updated each frame.
Due to Adobe Scout statistics it affects perfomance pretty much (at least 20%).
![uploadFromVector](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2535519/228299/c64425d0-867b-11e2-8e2a-8c9b7d70b9c6.png)

data.title: Positioning.
data.body:
I have an idea to simplify new object positioning.
You could add DisplayObject's centerPivots() method which performs something like this:

``` as3
{
  this.pivotX = 0.5 * this.width
  this.pivotY = 0.5 * this.height
}
```

data.title: Button with RenderTexture
Bitmap Font Registration Slow on iOS
data.body:
Calling TextField.registerBitmapFont on iOS takes much longer than expected (Android is practically instant).

All the details for what I'm referring to are here: http://forum.starling-framework.org/topic/bitmap-font-registration-slow

I never got a response, but I _think_ it's a bug, so I'm opening a ticket. Thanks!

data.title: clipRect with flatten
data.body: When using clipRect with flatten cliprect is removed. Don't know if this is done on purpose but with feathers scroller for example you cannot use flatten since scroll content will no longer be cropped.

data.title: monospace bitmap font layout problem
data.body:
I want to use a monospace font for timer display.

As a test, I created a monospace bitmap font (Courier) with GlyphDesigner and tried with Starling.
http://wonderfl.net/c/pf27

However, the layout was not expected.
Seems to change the layout by the last character of the line.

Modifieding BitmapFont.as as follows, the layout was expected.

https://github.com/PrimaryFeather/Starling-Framework/blob/master/starling/src/starling/text/BitmapFont.as#L361

``` actionscript
//var right:Number = lastLocation.x + lastLocation.char.width;
var right:Number = lastLocation.x - lastLocation.char.xOffset
                            + lastLocation.char.xAdvance;
```

data.title: Add some basic interfaces
data.body:
- IEventListener
- IDisplayObject

data.title: Maven and Nexus support?
data.body:
Hi, so I noticed that starling has maven pom file set up to deploy to the Sonatype OSS Nexus:
https://github.com/PrimaryFeather/Starling-Framework/blob/master/starling/build/maven/pom.xml

However, I'm unable to find any version on the OSS nexus:
https://oss.sonatype.org/index.html#nexus-search;quick~starling-framework

I was wondering if there was a reason why is not available there at all, and if you needed any assistance in keeping up with the releases on nexus as well. I'm fairly familiar with setting up and deploying flex projects to maven.

data.title: Pause Game
Sorry, please close this issue. Wrong repos.
data.body:
Scroll not complete when touch the scroll area after scrollToPageIndex()

The situation for reproduce the issue.
1. Call scrollToPageIndex() for a list for scroll to a page with animation. The list is snap to page.
2. Before the animation complete, touch the scroll area once.
3. The animation will stop and will not continue and snap to page. And not scroll complete event fire.

data.title: TextField.as - Check for drawWithQualityFunc generates a warning
data.body:
Patch follows

```
From 9641548a9dc24aa25fbea91980e40e3798dabb99 Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001
From: Alan <alan@mreshet.co.il>
Date: Sun, 10 Feb 2013 11:56:23 +0200
Subject: [PATCH] Fixed check for function reference.  if
 (drawWithQualityFunc) >  if (drawWithQualityFunc is
 Function)

---
 starling/src/starling/text/TextField.as | 2 +-
 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+), 1 deletion(-)

diff --git a/starling/src/starling/text/TextField.as b/starling/src/starling/text/TextField.as
index 995661d..3c02329 100644
--- a/starling/src/starling/text/TextField.as
+++ b/starling/src/starling/text/TextField.as
@@ -199,7 +199,7 @@ package starling.text
             // Beginning with AIR 3.3, we can force a drawing quality. Since "LOW" produces
             // wrong output oftentimes, we force "MEDIUM" if possible.

-            if (drawWithQualityFunc)
+            if (drawWithQualityFunc is Function)
                 drawWithQualityFunc.call(bitmapData, sNativeTextField, drawMatrix, 
                                          null, null, null, false, StageQuality.MEDIUM);
             else
-- 
1.8.0.msysgit.0
```

data.title: Don't blow up when drawWithQuality doesn't exist
data.body: This fixes a crash when BitmapData.drawWithQuality is called in a non-AIR environment
